item.title: Lorey's height: the remote sensing way to estimate tree height
item.description: A canopy of lowland conifer trees in northern Minnesota. One of the first things you learn in an forestry field course is how to measure the height of trees. Doing so is tricky, as itâ€™s difficult to locate the tops of many trees in dense forests (especially deciduous ones during leaf-on periods). Many foresters will sub-sample tree heights, for example only measuring the heights for every fifth tree or the four closest trees to plot center.
